citation.article-title: Muricauda olearia sp. nov., isolated from crude-oil-contaminated seawater, and emended description of the genus Muricauda
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Muricauda olearia sp. nov.
Muricauda olearia (o.le.a′ri.a. L. fem. adj. olearia pertaining to oil, referring to its source of isolation).
Gram-staining-negative, strictly aerobic, non-motile and non-spore-forming rods approximately 0.3–0.4 μm wide and 1.6–4.4 μm long.
Appendages similar to those reported in other Muricauda species occur on some cells.
After 3 days on MA at 30 °C, colonies are yellow, circular and convex, and approximately 1 mm in diameter.
Grows at 15–40 °C (optimum, 25–30 °C) and at pH 5.2–9.4 (optimum, pH 6.8–7.7).
Growth occurs at 1–6 % (w/v) sea-salt concentration (optimum, 2–3 %), but no growth occurs in media containing only NaCl.
Gelatin, tyrosine and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are hydrolysed, but casein, hypoxanthine, urea and xanthine are not.
Negative for H2S production and nitrate reductase.

According to the API ZYM test, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, acid and alkaline phosphatases, cystine arylamidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and valine arylamidase activities are present, but α-chymotrypsin, α-fucosidase, α- and β-galactosidases, α- and β-glucosidases, β-glucuronidase, lipase (C14), α-mannosidase and trypsin activities are absent.

l-Arginine, cellobiose, glucose, glutamate, lactose, pyruvate, raffinose and sucrose are utilized as sole carbon sources, but acetate, alanine, benzoate, citrate, ethanol, formate, fructose, mannitol, mannose, methanol, l-serine and succinate are not utilized.
Acid is produced from cellobiose, d-fructose, d-glucose, lactose, d-mannose, raffinose, d-ribose, sucrose and trehalose, but not from l-arabinose, d-galactose, myo-inositol, d-mannitol or d-xylose.

Sensitive to (μg per disc) ampicillin (6), cephalexin (20), gentamicin (6), kanamycin (20), mitomycin C (0.6), penicillin G (6), polymyxin B (25), streptomycin (6) and vancomycin (20), but resistant to chloramphenicol (20), erythromycin (10), nalidixic acid (20) and tetracycline (20).
Major cellular fatty acids are iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C15 : 1 G.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 50.7 mol%.
The type strain, CL-SS4T (=KCCM 90075T=JCM 15563T), was isolated from crude-oil-contaminated seawater from the west coast of Korea.
